description:
How hot is your PC’s graphics card temperature? During normal operations, your GPU temperature shouldn’t matter much—your graphics card should simply drive monitors and play games without overheating and shutting down. But if you have an older PC, a case with poor airflow, or if you tinker around with graphics card overclocking or undervolting, being able to monitor your GPU temperature is vital—especially when the summer heat is scorching indoors and out. There’s a reason that “may your temperatures be low” is a common saying among PC enthusiasts.

The good news? Checking
title: How to check your graphics card’s GPU temperature
